BB-8472-K_syn_1:
Indication: LLL nodule 19mm.
Procedure: EMN Bronchoscopy.
Findings: Concentric REBUS view.
Sampling: Needle x3, Biopsy x4, Brush x2.
Result: Tool-in-lesion confirmed. Samples sent.
Plan: Clinic f/u.
BB-8472-K_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Diagnostic Bronchoscopy with Electromagnetic Navigation.
INDICATION: 19mm PET-positive LLL nodule.
TECHNIQUE: Navigation was performed to the target lesion. Radial EBUS confirmed a concentric orientation. Transbronchial needle aspiration, forceps biopsy, and brushing were performed. Fluoroscopy time was 5.1 minutes. Post-procedure chest x-ray was negative for pneumothorax.
BB-8472-K_syn_3:
Codes: 31627 (Nav), 31629 (TBNA), 31628 (Bx), 31654 (REBUS).
Justification: Multimodal sampling of peripheral nodule utilizing navigation and ultrasound confirmation.
BB-8472-K_syn_4:
Resident Note
Patient: [REDACTED]
Procedure: Nav Bronch.
Steps:
1. Nav to LLL.
2. REBUS concentric.
3. TBNA x 3.
4. Bx x 4.
5. Brush x 2.
No complications.
BB-8472-K_syn_5: bronch for Kathryn Janeway LLL nodule. used the electromagnetic nav. got a good signal. radial ebus concentric. took biopsies needle and brush. fluoro was 5 mins. patient stable.
BB-8472-K_syn_6: Flexible bronchoscopy with electromagnetic navigation. Indication: Peripheral LLL nodule. Moderate sedation. EMN localization successful. Radial EBUS concentric. Samples obtained via needle, forceps, and brush. No pneumothorax.
BB-8472-K_syn_7:
[Indication]
LLL Nodule.
[Anesthesia]

[Description]

BB-8472-K_syn_8: We performed a navigational bronchoscopy on Samantha Carter to biopsy a 19mm nodule in the left lower lung. We successfully reached the nodule and confirmed it with ultrasound. We took multiple samples using different tools to ensure we get a diagnosis. There were no complications.
BB-8472-K_syn_9:
Procedure: Navigational bronchoscopy.
Action: The LLL lesion was localized. Concentric ultrasound confirmation was achieved. Tissue was harvested via aspiration, biopsy, and brushing. 
Result: Diagnostic procedure completed.
